title: frequently asked questions
text:
Is parking a boat, RV or trailer on my property allowed?





There are restrictions for parking boats, RV’s, and trailers within the community. These items must be concealed from public view and cannot be parked on the street. The community CC&R’s clearly define these restrictions and subject the homeowner to fines for violation.









What happens if I do not pay my assessment?





The maintenance and management services incurred by the Association are dependent upon timely receipt of the assessments due from each homeowner. Late payments will result in a late charge as assessments are due on the first of the month. In addition, the CC&R’s allows the Association to charge late charges and interest and proceed with a lien on your property, or foreclosure proceeding for nonpayment of assessments.

title: resources
text:
ByLaws
The Amendment to the Bylaws of Casa Buena (Version 8.0)… included here was approved by the Board of Directors on June 14, 2018 and amends Version 7.0 of the Bylaws that had been approved on February 8, 2017 by the Board of Directors and recorded on February 15, 2017. The Version 8.0 changes were technical in nature and included:
• Changing the word Member to Owner so as to be consistent with terminology through the Bylaws and other Association documents. • Changing the term absentee ballot to written ballet to be consistent with the HOA Rules and other Association documents. • Removing filing Corporation Commission reports from the Treasurer’s responsibilities and adding to the Secretary’s responsibilities.

title: resources
text:
architectural review
All exterior modifications require prior approval by the Architectural Review Committee. For any assistance or guidance with the HOA with regards to exterior remodels, updates, painting, etc., please submit an architectural review form to the Architectural Review Committee.
